The use of a long `if/elif/else` chain for handling different export formats is not ideal for scalability or maintainability. This structure violates the Open/Closed Principle, as adding a new export format requires modifying this method directly.

Consider refactoring this logic using the Strategy design pattern. You could define an `ExportStrategy` interface with an `export` method, and create concrete implementations like `JsonExportStrategy`, `CsvExportStrategy`, etc. A factory could then be used to select the appropriate strategy based on the `export_format` string. This would make the system much easier to extend with new formats in the future without changing the service class.

title: feat: Add post export functionality
body: This change introduces the ability to export posts into different formats (JSON, CSV, TXT). A new method, export_post, has been added to the PostService to handle this logic.
